notes: Expected at least 3 tool calls, observed 0.
No successful read/list/search tool call observed.
No successful write tool call observed (write_file/replace/apply_patch).

critical_issues: All four output files are empty JSON objects (`{}`), so they fail the required schemas (as indicated by validationErrors) and are not usable for downstream review.

Coverage is effectively zero: none of the report’s main findings are represented (e.g., dayside brightness temperature 342±22 K [L27], heat transport efficiency epsilon 0.19(+0.23/-0.14) [L28], Bond albedo <0.08 [L29], CO2 band depth estimate 96 ppm [L30], likelihood ratio 7.4 favoring atmosphere models [L31], preferred pressure scale 0.3–1.0 bar in CO2-rich family [L32]).

Core study design context is missing (JWST MIRI low-resolution phase-curve spectroscopy; thermal phase variation + ~15 µm CO2 band; retrieval comparison of atmosphere-free vs atmosphere-bearing models [L14-L17]).

Key controls/null and conditional conclusions are absent: no-atmosphere model can’t match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior [L35]; O2-rich not fully ruled out [L36]; important degeneracies remain [L37].

Major caveats/threats to validity are omitted (single-planet inference limits [L47]; retrieval assumption sensitivity [L48]; stellar variability/instrument systematics [L49]; weaker nightside constraints [L50]).
Because the outputs contain no claims and no line references, they cannot satisfy the requirement that claims be grounded with valid mappings to numbered report lines.
value.summary: The generated outputs are empty and schema-invalid, providing none of the report’s findings, quantitative results, controls, or caveats. They are therefore neither faithful nor practically useful for review.
